entry.title: arc-overview-tracing: new min time only if active
entry.content:
Prior this CL, we set the trace min time whenever focus changes to an

ARC window. This can affect the trace whose model is in the process of

being built, which can either cause a DCHECK failure or simply filter

out all events as being out-of-range.



Instead, only record a new min time if a trace is active.



Note this code path is not supposed to happen for every trace, but only

when the user changes focus during a trace. Before and after this CL,

the min time gets updated upon starting a trace explicitly with the key

binding.



Bug: b:292250976

Bug: b:293659442

Test: ArcGraphicsTracingHandlerTest

Test: on brya, when a trace's model is building, switch to a different ARC window

Test: on brya, when a trace's model is building, switch back to the traced ARC window

Change-Id: I8b39b83998fdebe0e7406ea1b0e05683db03d202

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4753052

Auto-Submit: Matthew DeVore

Reviewed-by: Yury Khmel

Commit-Queue: Matthew DeVore

entry.title: ios: Locally revert os_version_check change in compiler-rt
entry.content:
https://reviews.llvm.org/D150397 changed __isPlatformVersionAtLeast

to declare _availability_version_check as a weak_import instead of

looking it up at runtime using dlsym.



However, the AppStore considers _availability_version_check to be

a private API.



Until this issue is resolved, locally revert this compiler-rt

change with a version of os_version_check before D150397.



Bug: 1471650

Low-Coverage-Reason: Workaround compiler-rt issue

entry.title: [infra] Enforce the existence of an orchestrator's compilator.
entry.content:
Previously, the orchestrator_builder and compilator_builder functions

were unconditionally calling register_orchestrator or

register_compilator, respectively. This meant that in all cases the

nodes would exist and so the generator wouldn't fail, even if the

compilator builder wasn't defined (due to missing the necessary branch

selector on a branch project). In that case, the orchestrator would be

defined, but it wouldn't have the necessary property defined to know

which compilator to trigger. Even if it did have the property set as

expected, the compilator wouldn't exist to trigger.



This changes it so that register_orchestrator and register_compilator

are only called if the builder is actually defined (try_.builder returns

non-None). try_.builder was updated to actually return the result of

builders.builder so that the return value could be used to detect the

builder being defined. With this change in place, the

branch-config-verifier will fail if a compilator's branch selector isn't

at least as inclusive as the orchestrator's branch selector.



Bug: 1471673

Change-Id: I5e96220ecc32bdaf461fa61a4152a43a8be73c4c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4767159

Commit-Queue: Wanda Mora

Commit-Queue: Garrett Beaty

Reviewed-by: Wanda Mora

Auto-Submit: Garrett Beaty

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181773}

entry.title: Revert "[Tracing] Use Perfetto client library for tracing on Android"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 915cca4e568f662cbfc0f4a47c2911550225c352.



Reason for revert: Potential culprit for Trace-related test failing

on Android. See crbug.com/1471763.



Original change's description:

> [Tracing] Use Perfetto client library for tracing on Android

>

> This CL switches the Chrome tracing backend to Perfetto client

> library. It means that Chrome on Android will use a different set of

> TRACE_EVENT* macros that call Perfetto client API under the hood.

>

> The Perfetto backend has been the default on desktop Linux since

> March. Now we make it the default on Android too. Our end goal is to

> make Perfetto the default backend on all platforms, unblocking

> multiple improvements in tracing stability and usefulness.

>

> Significant effort has been made to make the binary size impact as

> small as possible, but some overhead remains. See this thread:

> https://groups.google.com/a/google.com/d/msgid/woa-performance-team/CABiQX1XriNOZcYRBtO2JWq2Uzqbgjh_4ZMuXXaPJUdp%3DvkTZ-g%40mail.gmail.com

> for more info and discussion.

>

> Binary-Size: See above.

> Bug: 1006541

> Change-Id: Ia6ab96a6f3402f446fefab872c41686f480c2ed5

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4701264

> Reviewed-by: Eric Seckler

> Reviewed-by: Andrew Grieve

entry.title: Reland "[fuchsia] Switch browsertests to Flatland"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit c537ce7cc0798182b5747ff7857a0bb0784ce8d2



Previously this broke component builds because FrameWindowTreeHost was

not exported.



Original change's description:

> [fuchsia] Switch browsertests to Flatland

>

> Switch Browsertests to run with the Flatland TestUiStack, and remove

> scenic hardcoding in WebEngineTestLauncher. WebEngineBrowserMainParts

> picks the appropriate Ozone platform based on

> fuchsia.ui.scenic/Scenic.UseFlatland. Test configurations that cannot

> use Scenic or Flatland should use Headless instead with

> --ozone-platform=headless. See crrev.com/c/4001000 for example.

>

> * web_engine_browsertests now runs with the Flatland TestUiStack.

> * cast_runner_browsertests now runs with the same Flatland TestUiStack

> to detect Scenic.

> * FrameImplTest.VisibilityState is migrated to CreateView2 because

> GraphicalPresenter no longer accepts GFX parameters.

> * VirtualKeyboardTest and KeyboardInputTest are migrated to CreateView2

> because they assert the KOID of the ViewRef.

> * VirtualKeyboardTest and KeyboardInputTest are skipped when ran with

> headless Ozone because keyboard events are ignored.

>

> Tests can continue to use Frame.CreateView and

> Frame.CreateViewWithViewRef for now, since GFX APIs are still present.

> Future CLs will migrate these to CreateView2.

>

>

> Bug: 1300993

> Change-Id: I9655bf1ec5185cf6949e21b89db54490ef28e58a

entry.title: ViewShadow modifies rounded corners of view layer
entry.content:
When setting rounded corners to ViewShadow, the same rounded

corners will also be applied to the view. This may cause problems.

For example, the focus ring is a child of the view, and it will be

clipped if the focus ring is outside the view.



We should make the view to decide its layer's rounded corners

instead of letting ViewShadow to modify it.



Bug: b:295205108

Change-Id: Ie61bb129999c3578568d4a48918ba8922da442da

loading logic off the main thread. To run the loading logic in the

entry.title: Re-enable flaky checks for blink web tests + perf tests
entry.content:
The solution identifying new tests has migrated to a ResultDB-based

solution, which relives us from hardware restrictions that previously

did not let us test new tests for flakiness.



Removing this flag to cover the case for when WPT tests are introduced

directly to chromium. wpt-importer has been updated to skip flaky checks

for rolls into chromium and will handle it separately.

entry.title: weblayer: sets webview_includes_weblayer to false
entry.content:
I'm in the process of removing weblayer. The bots are no longer

building any of the tests, but because webview binary includes

weblayer, the code is still built. This sets

webview_includes_weblayer to false so that weblayer is no longer

built.



Setting webview_includes_weblayer to false exposes some other

random build issues, which are fixed here as well.



Also, as webview no longer includes weblayer I also had to update

binary expectation files.

entry.title: Remove unused VRB UI
entry.content:
Prunes UI code that is no longer used/referenced as it appears to have

been removed with the rest of the VRB code. Note that some items that

are removed were removed because it appears as though they were only

referenced by some items that have been removed in this patchset.



This does not remove all unused VRB UI, but makes a good first pass.

My intention is to land this, let code search update and then use that

to help find more now-unused items. There are some items that are used

for GVR currently that may not be used long-term for Cardboard and these

will be evaluated when implementing this UI for cardboard.



This change is intended to help reduce the binary size for Cardboard,

which will need to take a dependency on some of this code to show

the "unresponsive" fallback UI.

entry.title: Disable malware extensions based on verdicts from Extension Telemetry Server
entry.content:
Adds the ExtensionTelemetryServiceVerdictHandler class to the

ExtensionService. This class is used by the ExtensionTelemetryService

to process malware verdicts for offstore extensions received from the

Extension Telemetry

server.



The Handler performs action based on the verdict:

- For malware verdict, the extension is unloaded and assigned a

malware blocklist state.

- For not-blocklisted/unknown verdict, the extension is reloaded and

its malware blocklist state is removed.



A follow-on CL will implement the code where the ExtensionService will

call this handler to process the Extension Telemetry server's verdicts.

entry.content:

Reason for revert: Suspecting causing the failure for virtual/percent-based-scrolling/max-percent-delta.html (https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac12%20Tests/11844/overview). > Dont use NativeThemeFluent when OverlayScrollbars are on.

>

> Overlay Scrollbars (enabled via chrome://flags or command line argument

> --enable-features=OverlaySCrollbar) use NativeThemeAura; if they are

> enabled we shouldn't use Fluent Scrollbar's Native Theme. With this

> change, if both flags are enabled Overlay Scrollbars take precedence.

entry.title: [Auto-disable Accessibility] Add histograms for feature usage
entry.content:
This CL continues the work of the Auto-disable accessibility feature

in preparation of enabling the feature for A/B testing.



With this CL we add histograms to track usage of the feature. We will

track how often we enable/disable the feature, and how long the given

instance was in the current state before changing (e.g. how long was

accessibility enabled before being auto-disabled, or, how long was

accessibility disabled before re-enabling). We also separate these

into initial and successive categories to separate the first call for

each instance from any later calls.

entry.title: Remove URL validity assertions from AutocompleteController.
entry.content:
The intention for these URLs was to capture cases where we get called

with an invalid URL. In practice, these URLs are updated independently

from the actual call being made: calls to AutocompleteController are

made long after the URL is invalid.

entry.title: FSA: Implement helper function to return persisted grant state value
entry.content:
Adds new `PersistedGrantState` enum class that represents the three

different states (no overlap) that persisted grants for a given origin

can exist as.



Implements a helper method `GetPersistedGrantState` which retrieves

the persisted grant state, for the given criteria under the Persistent

Permissions design.



Updates existing methods to only rely on this new helper method to

determine persisted grant state.

entry.title: shimless: Update gradient to match spec
entry.content:
In order to match the spec, this CL overrides the default styles of the

shadows from CrContainerShadowMixin. Primarily, it replaces the

`box-shadow` with a `background: linear-gradient` so we can have

more control over the appearance of the gradient. This CSS also

overrides the height to 20px. Finally, I've updated the margin-bottom

and margin-top negative values to reflect the change in shadow height;

note that this negative value trick is also used in the base component:

https://crsrc.org/c/ui/webui/resources/cr_elements/cr_shared_vars.css;l=236;drc=dcb3844ce8b6c4fafc580b3c9fefb4e2dd8f6727

entry.title: [CDM] Moving ownership of ModelManager to StorageService
entry.content:
In this CL,

1. ModelManager initialisation is moved to StorageService.

2. StorageService is initialised after the default models are

initialised and fetched and written to database.

3. Changes to make default model init and fetch and writing to database

synchronous.



This ensures that the models are available as early as possible to avoid

delay in executions. This would also make it easier to deprecate

DefaultModelManager going forward.

ModelManager stores providers, hence it made more sense to be owned by

StorageService.



Change-Id: I3c0aa5560ed987878623c40096b4bbc59ce2dcec

entry.title: Preliminary functionality: create MSI installers from offline installers
entry.content:
MSI installers package an offline/standalone installer, and can be built

using `msi_from_standalone.py` in this CL. This is a work in progress.



`msi_from_standalone.py` builds an MSI around the supplied standalone

installer. This MSI installer is intended to enable enterprise

installation scenarios while being as close to a normal install as

possible.



This method only works for application installers that do not use MSI.



For example, to create `GoogleChromeBetaStandaloneEnterprise.msi` from

`ChromeBetaOfflineSetup.exe`:

```

python3 chrome/updater/win/signing/msi_from_standalone.py

--candle_path ../third_party/wix/v3_8_1128/files/candle.exe

--light_path ../third_party/wix/v3_8_1128/files/light.exe

--product_name "Google Chrome Beta"

--product_version "110.0.5478.0"

--appid {8237E44A-0054-442C-B6B6-EA0509993955}

--product_custom_params "&brand=GCEA"

--product_uninstaller_additional_args=--force-uninstall

--product_installer_data "%7B%22dis%22%3A%7B%22msi%22%3Atrue%7D%7D"

--standalone_installer_path ChromeBetaOfflineSetup.exe

--custom_action_dll_path out/Default/msi_custom_action.dll

--msi_base_name GoogleChromeBetaStandaloneEnterprise

--enterprise_installer_dir chrome/updater/win/signing

--output_dir out/Default

```



Bug: 1465914

Change-Id: I1381294fb34f2916c35c11787e125bebc0284b4d

entry.title: [Cast2Class] Update dialog to use updated styles
entry.content:
For Chrome refresh, the style for Chrome is updating, and it necessary

to add an html attribute so that our WebUI dialog receives the updated

style as well.



Additionally, browser dialogs should have an updated corner radius. So,

make sure to use the default for browser dialogs, and only manually set

corner radius in the case that we are acting as a system dialog.



As a note, the corner raduis for system dialogs should also be updated

according to the spec, but for now leave our value as is to match

SystemWebDialogDelegate.

entry.title: Misc. menu code cleanup.
entry.content:
* Only use InMenuButtonBackground on buttons (it had no effect on

non-buttons).

* Pass optionals by const ref and not value where possible

* C++17 no longer needs definition points for static constexpr class members

* Better variable names and comments

* Use `const` more

* Use inheriting constructors

* Make code shorter, e.g. by inlining or adding temps

* Unindent via early-returns

* Make definition order match declaration order

* Add {} around conditional bodies

* Declare variables as close to first use as possible

* DCHECK -> CHECK

* Remove `item_min_height`, which was basically redundant with other min

height config values. This is a slight behavioral change, as it stops

applying item min heights to combobox entries; that seems correct to

me.

* Apply min heights to highlighted entries since they paint correctly.

* Use View's default fill layout

* Give the non-bubble menu background the border width, to improve

graphical fidelity in the corners



Bug: none

entry.title: Migrate single threaded tests to virtual test suite
entry.content:
This change switches from using a list of tests that should run single

threaded (SingleThreadedTests) to a VirtualTestSuite approach. This is

being done to support a longer-term effort to use virtual tests upstream

in wpt, where a bespoke single threaded list would not work. A followup

patch will delete the old SingleThreadedTests file.



For more information see go/enable-threaded-compositing

entry.title: [ui fonts] Add --system-font-family command line switch
entry.content:
Headless and headful Chrome use different font faces to render

the 'system-ui' font family on Linux. This is undesirable

for test automation. The difference is caused by the fact that

headful uses GTK while headless uses ozone/headless.



Note that this does not happen on Mac and Windows because they

always use the same platform graphics.



This CL introduces a command line switch that allows user to

explicitly specify system font family name thus bypassing

the automatic system font family selection logic.



Bug: 1470313

entry.title: Avoid HashSet of Member in Node::GetAncestorTreeScopes
entry.content:
In case a GC happens while the HashSet is used, any objects referred

to only from the HashSet will be considered unreachable by the GC and

will be reclaimed. This can lead to UAF and memory corruptions.

Using a HeapHashSet instead solves the issue.



Bug: 1470687

entry.title: Multiplanar: Restrict SIFormat service GL util methods
entry.content:
This change restricts the GLDataType(), GLDataFormat(),

GLInternalFormat() and TextureStorageFormat() methods within

SharedImageFormatRestrictedUtilsAccessor so that they are called only

from the ToGLFormatDesc() method. This helps have a single GLFormat

source within shared image format utils.

It also makes sure that clients that need external sampler call the

equivalent ToGLFormatDescExternalSampler() making it explicit.

entry.title: Multiplanar: Use ToGLFormatDesc instead of separate GL format utils
entry.content:
This change removes usages of GLDataType(), GLDataFormat(),

GLInternalFormat() and TextureStorageFormat() to instead use

ToGLFormatDesc() which returns the GLFormatDesc instead. This helps

have a single GLFormat source within shared image format utils.

It also makes sure that clients that need external sampler call the

equivalent ToGLFormatDescExternalSampler() making it explicit.

entry.title: [iOS] Propagate badges on hidden items to Settings
entry.content:
To achieve this, _destinationOrderData is now slightly divorced from

what the destination provider says are the active badge types. If the

destination provider says a hidden item has an error badge, then that's

stored in _destinationOrderData as well.



Then when the full overflowMenuDestinations are gathered together, any

extra badges must be applied.

entry.title: Detect when GetSystemMemoryInfo gets a too-large speculative_count
entry.content:
On Apple platforms, GetSystemMemoryInfo uses `host_statistics64`,

which fills a `vm_info` struct with various memory metrics. However,

each field is computed separately rather than representing the same

instant in time. In particular, the `speculative_count` field

is computed at a different point in time than the `free_count` field.



GetSystemMemoryInfo currently subtracts `speculative_count` from

`free_count` to compute `meminfo->free`, but this implicitly assumes

that the two counts represent the same point in time. Since they do

not, it is possible for `speculative_count` to be greater than

`free_count`, and in this case subtraction produces a garbage value,

which gets converted into INT_MAX by saturated_cast in the computation

of `meminfo->free`, leading to crashes in checked_casts when this

value is used in later computations.



This CL detects this case in `GetSystemMemoryInfo` and sets

`meminfo->free` to 0, which is the best possible approximation.



Bug: 1467759

Change-Id: I24a10574867963ee9ee1118d1004ffcaaece85c3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4749381

Commit-Queue: Ali Juma

Reviewed-by: Justin Cohen

Reviewed-by: Mark Mentovai

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181604}
